section.title: Messaging Commands
section.para: Output messages from command lists / filters. All commands work like the C printf() command, and accept the same ((Formatting Strings|formatting tokens)). All output from these messaging commands is directed to either the GUI message box or stdout on the command line.

listitem.para: ((Formatting Strings)) for in-depth explanations on the usage of C-style formatted output
((Commands: Read Write)) for commands to read/write from/to files.^

section.title: error
section.para: Print a message to screen and immediately exit the current command structure / filter.
section.synopsis: int err=23; error("Filter failed badly - error = %i.\n", err);
section.para: notifies the user that something bad probably happened, provided the error code, and promptly exits.

section.title: printf
section.para: prints the string "Loading data..." to the screen.
prints the contents of the variable natoms to the screen.

section.title: verbose
section.para: Prints a message, but only when verbose output is enabled (with the -v command-line switch).
